input_schema.description: A single cat photograph to evaluate for technical visual clarity.

cat_photo.description: A photograph of a cat to be evaluated for technical visual clarity, including its lighting, sharpness and focus, and freedom from noise and artifacts.

content.text: How is the lighting on the cat in this photograph? Is the cat illuminated well enough that you can clearly see its form, features, and textures?

responses.text: The cat is well-lit and clearly visible. Its form, features, and fur textures are all easy to see — the exposure is good and the lighting is sufficient.
The lighting is okay but not great. The cat is visible, though some areas are a bit dark or slightly washed out, making it harder to see all the details.
The lighting is poor. The cat is lost in shadow or blown out by overexposure — I can barely make out its form and features.

content.text: I took this photo of my cat. Can you tell me whether the cat itself is sharp and in focus, or if it's blurry?

responses.text: The cat is sharp and in focus. I can see crisp edges, fine detail in the fur, and clear definition in the eyes and ears. There's no motion blur or softness on the subject.
The cat is somewhat soft. It's recognizable, but the edges aren't fully crisp — there's a bit of blur or the focus isn't quite locked on the cat, so some fine detail is lost.
The cat is blurry or out of focus. I can't make out clear details — the subject is a soft smear or the focal point has missed the cat entirely.

content.text: Can you check this cat photo for digital noise, grain, or compression artifacts? I want to know if the image is clean or if there's visual interference degrading the picture.
Sure, please share the photo and I'll examine it for noise and artifacts.

responses.text: The image is clean. I don't see significant noise, grain, or compression artifacts. The cat's fur and features are rendered smoothly and clearly without visual interference.
There is some visible noise or minor compression artifacts in the image. The cat is still recognizable, but the grain or blockiness slightly detracts from the overall clarity.
The image is heavily degraded. There is substantial noise, grain, or compression artifacts throughout — the cat's details are obscured and the picture looks rough and unclear.

description: Scores the technical visual clarity of a single cat photo on a 0-to-1 scale by evaluating three qualities: lighting, sharpness and focus, and freedom from noise and artifacts. High scores mean the cat is well-lit, crisp, and easy to see; low scores mean it is dark, blurry, or degraded. Excludes judgments about composition or aesthetics.
